Package fr.cnrs.iees.omhtk

Interface Textable

All Known Implementing Classes:
DynamicList, QuickListOfLists, Uid
public interface Textable

An interface for relatively complex objects that can return information with various levels of detail.

This interface should not be used to save objects as text. For this task, the SaveableAsText interface is better adapted.

These methods complement the Object.toString() method that is used in eclipse for debugging code.

Author:
gignoux - 25 ao√ªt 2017

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default String
    toDetailedString()
    Displays the object with all - or at least a lot of - the detailed of its content, for screen or console display purpose.
    default String
    toShortString()
    Displays the object as simply as possible, with no guarantee that another object will not return the same string.
    default String
    toUniqueString()
    Displays the object as simply as possible, showing its unicity as an instance.

  • Method Details

    • toUniqueString

      default String toUniqueString()
      Displays the object as simply as possible, showing its unicity as an instance. Typically, it should show the object address + some indication of the object content. Or if the object has a unique ID (e.g. graph elements), it should use it.
      Returns:
      a String uniquely characterising this instance

    • toShortString

      default String toShortString()

      Displays the object as simply as possible, with no guarantee that another object will not return the same string.

      The returned description must fit on one single, short (~20 character), line of text.

      Returns:
      a short String describing this instance

    • toDetailedString

      default String toDetailedString()

      Displays the object with all - or at least a lot of - the detailed of its content, for screen or console display purpose.

      The returned description should not contain line breaks.

      Returns:
      a long String describing this instance.
